intro: Listrostachys fragrantissima, commonly known as the sweet-scented honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its fragrant, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in shades of yellow and orange. The plant produces small, red or orange berries that are edible and often consumed by birds and small mammals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its pleasant aroma and vibrant floral display.
